location.merchant_description_html: Serving all souls! Soulfire makes foodies shimmy and shake with the most devastatingly delicious barbeque around. Their food, infused with the sweet vibe of Memphis and decades of musical tradition, speaks to the spirit and the stomach! Hickory smoked ribs, juicy chicken and tender pork shoulders rule the menu. Fact: You may become the ultimate sauce-monger after sampling their variety of BBQ slathers, but it’s cool. Dig in and lick your lips without shame, SoulFire—this stuff is WAY too good to waste.

I’m going to surprise my boyfriend and take him on a date. At Montien, they have cozy boxed-in booths, perfect for a romantic meal. Or maybe we’ll try the open window seating, so we can feel the breeze. I want it to feel really authentic, you know? Healthy, authentic Thai food, celebrating a sweet relationship. I’m thinking Mango Curry Chicken for me, and he’ll try the sushi bar. Good idea. The meals are huge and the drinks are mind-blowing. What a great plan! I can also order delivery & take-out with LevelUp! All I need to do now is find a boyfriend…
location.street_address: 63 Stuart Street (Pay with LevelUp for Delivery!)

location.merchant_description_html: Boston’s Best Irish Bar for 6 years, Hennessy is trying to woo you. A true Irish gentleman, he’ll show you to an open window seat to gaze at the bustling summertime Faneuil Hall crowd. When the snowy streets got you time-traveling to ‘76, he has a spot by the coal fireplace for you. After a hearty Sheperd’s Pie and a few $2 seasonal beers, he’ll take the leap and whisk you to the dance floor. No Irish step though--only live music 7 days a week, including karaoke Wednesdays and a bangin’ DJ on weekends.

Rustica...I believe that’s Italian for an old wooden ship. Yes, yes it is. And fine ships they were. The Mighty Brussel: the shipdecks are coated in a luxuriously decadent cheesy white sauce, while the staff in the engine room roast up brussel sprouts and caramelized onions for a delicious garnish. The ‘Sexy Singles” Submarine (aptly named the Enrico Suave Sub) features a homemade hoagie with the bod of a baguette, filled with lots of chick(en)s, broccoli rabe, sharp provolone and roasted red peppers.

Miel Patisserie’s French confections are habit-forming. Case in point: Before the Rittenhouse shop opened, die-hards would trek to Jersey for one bite of their famed macaroons. The legendary, light, pillow-like delights are filled with vanilla, black cherry, chocolate, coconut, coffee or lemon poppy. Ordering one would be a crime--we suggest three. The treats are best enjoyed against an authentic backdrop; textured walls, giant mirrors, and bistro seating. It’s a slice of Cannes in the heart of Philadelphia!

Are you a Cafe Luna-tic yet? How can you not be! This Central Square gem has it all. They offer the meal trifecta; breakfast, lunch and dinner--and--a trio of seating options; indoor linen-topped tables, patio seats and front row stools. From coffee to wine, baked Belgian Waffles to homemade Lasagna--there’s not a weak link on the menu. It’s a quick, order-at-the-counter cafe with all of the hospitality and charm of a fine sit-down restaurant. Give it a try and see whats making everyone rave and crave.

People are attracted to the glowing orange sign out front like flies to those bug zapping lights: wide-eyed and hungry. But wait! Before you enter Hummus, you must have your teleportation hat on. One bite (nay, one whiff) of the smooth, garlic-y hummus or the smoky spiced lamb kabob, and you somehow wind up in the heart of Tel-Aviv, dining with locals on the Mediterranean coastline. When you leave, try and bring back some more hummus for us, pretty please?

There's a reason why people are always kissin' the Irish, they're the most fun. Lucky for you, everyone who sets foot in Paddy O's is granted honorary citizenship. You'll sip $2 drafts, dance your heart out and if the moment is right, bring down the house with some karaoke. All that AND and an edible nightcap of Bangers and Mash?! Boston, you can keep your flashy clubs and ultra lounges, this Irish pub makes my heart jig.

Tired of your boss giving you grief about suiting up in fisherman’s yellow and hitting the river during your lunch hour? Truth be told, the secretary isn’t jazzed about you skinning your catch in the office either. We’ve got a fix that won’t skimp on freshness: Misora Express!  It’s a snappy spot where you can get a sushi or meat Bento Box for $10 in under 10-mins. There are 18 box options that come with Miso, salad, rice and box-specific sides! Get goin’, the sweet skewers and hunks of tekka are calling!

The Random Tea & Curiosity shop is like the Mad Hatter’s quirky, whimsical vacation home. Don’t even try to rationalize the randomness--the moon rock on the ceiling, the elf-written signs, the one-of-a-kind trinkets for sale. Just grab a seat and a cup of tea and let it all soak in.There’s am endless array of flavors and styles to try, from therapeutic herbal infusions to full-bodied black teas of Sri Lanka, even blooming pots of Dragon Tail. Swing anytime, it’s always tea time here!
location.merchant_name: The Random Tea Room & Curiosity Shop

location.merchant_description_html: True Grounds is the epitome of jazzy java! This artsy upbeat crowd loves to jam out and admire funky, local art while they sip on smooth Iced Honey Lattes and devour tart Triple Berry Muffins. This is an extremely rare case where the food and the atmosphere are on the same level: awesome. The sitting situation caters to the singletons, though you’re welcome to push tables together to create a more knights-o-the-coffee-table vibe!

Me and my bud tried that place over yonder—Wild Willy’s. Now, I ain’t from around these parts, but I know a chop-lickin’ burger from a donkey hide, believe you me. I heard they had 100% certified Angus beef, so we saddled up the horses and moseyed on down. He liked the Willy Burger. I liked the Round Up Burger. It’s a faceoff. Our hands move to our holsters. Draw! He throws paper, I throw scissors, but since I’m such a nice cowboy, I call it a draw and settle over a homemade root beer float. Yeehaw!

When your dog looks up at you with those puppy dog eyes, he’s likely begging to go to Pawsh! Balki, the owners’ dog, will show you around to the toys, accessories, and treats (all of which he’s tested himself—for “quality assurance”). Your dog can be groomed or just play in the store. Shop for cute clothes like Bruins shirts (woo champs!) or a tux—you know, for those special occasions. Look out for MSPCA and adoption events, too! Now that we’ve decoded the meaning of that pitiful look, you have no excuse.

Sebastians is a local, family-owned business that serves the freshest, finest American and International fare to the Boston and Cambridge, Massachusetts communities.  Our cafés in Boston and Cambridge serve health conscience menus for breakfast, coffee, and lunch, while providing drop-off corporate catering to businesses, and special event catering to the Commonwealth.

I guess you could say we are Wicked Fresh! ;)
location.name: Kendall

location.merchant_description_html: Attached? Fuji Mountain’s sushi plates are best conquered with a date. You can canoodle at cozy tables and nosh on the freshest, most vibrant pieces of fish in the city, all while romantic Japanese lanterns glow overhead. Spice things up with the Millennium Tuna Roll, a tuna and cucumber aphrodisiac topped with hot tobiko. Be sure to leave all of your fellow diners wasabi-green with envy with the ultimate display of PDA --a shared Udon noodle a la Lady and the Tramp.

What’s with the name of this cup-cakery? It comes from the most common response to their frosted treats,“damn, these cupcakes kickass!” Kickass Cupcakes stands at the top of every Bostonians bakery list with an unrivaled variety of unique flavors. Some are made everyday, like The Mojito-- vanilla cake soaked with rum, coated with sugar cane lime frosting & fresh mint. Others like The Choc-annoli are limited edition specialties. All flavors are made fresh daily in small batches with quality ingredients!

One day, a small yet tyrannical tot licked his cup clean of ice cream and began clanging spoons on the table in a silvery riot. One would assume he wanted more of the sweet stuff, but he cried out, “More than just ice cream!” Eager to satisfy Lord Dribble Chin, the staff emerged with Deep Dish Apple Pie, which taunted his jaw span, followed by Mac & Cheese that proved to be as comforting as the plush velvet couches that line the place. More he wanted and more he got, but don’t worry, they saved some for you.

The fashion warrior is eager to dive into the racks at Once Worn, and search for consigned gold. They’ve got funky pieces by obscure labels alongside fresh brand name pieces. Want an insider tip? Keep an eye on the Facebook page for trendy new arrivals. But move quickly! These hot fashion finds have consign-addicts launching themselves over each other to get first pick. Winners come out waving their new dress high over their heads—the flag of victory. It’s ok to be jealous…we’re jealous, too.

“Bro, what’s the deal with all the fancy pizza?” “I dunno man, it’s like, gimme sauce and cheese on a piece of bread and feed me like the cafeteria lady, yknow?” “Yeah totally man, that specialty stuff is for herbs. Like, why the heck would I want a ‘Going to the Sun’ Pizza with garlic pesto sauce, pinenuts, sun-dried tomatoes, parmesan, mozzarella, provolone and goat cheese?” “Yeah dude...that’d be pretty strange if you liked that...” “Totally. Totally weird...” “...yeah...bizzare...” Ahem, #denial.

In true post Faneuil Hall shenanigans style, I release a guttural, mouth-stuffed “This is the best thing I’ve tasted in my whole life.” Saus serves up Belgian Liege Waffles (palm sized grids of gluttonous glory) with powdered pearl sugar and homemade ‘Saus’es like Homemade Nutella and Salted Caramel. Twice-fried crispy Pommes Frites (see: bomb fries) beg for one (or more) of 9 sauces like the Saturday Night Chive or Ole Chipotle. Mmm, is it illegal to sleepover in Quincy Market and come back at breakfast?

Scali Deli invites you to act like a high roller while ordering breakfast. Where else in Boston can you waltz up to the counter of a deli with card shark swagger and smoothly say “I’ll have the Bada Bing?” A Bada Bing will score you a hearty omelet  filled with sausage, bacon, ham and cheese. Is there a Bada Boom? Of course there is, that’d be a Bada Bing on a roll. Both are best enjoyed hot, so grab a seat and stay awhile while you bask in your breakfast jackpot.

If Poseidon is the intimidating, to-be-feared Lord of the Sea, then Snockey’s is Triton, his much more reasonable and personable son. Snockey’s features the freshest in seafood. They come from old school roots, with old school prices. The Snockey’s have been shuckin’ and truckin’ clams, oysters and shrimp to South Philly since 1912. Bring a date to the  raw bar for a cozy local atmosphere, MangoTango cocktails and “Clammy Hour” raw bar prices. The only place it’s encouraged to get your palms all clammy.

We’ve been tracking the Financial District power players, the smooth operators of the Back Bay dating scene and clean cut weekenders of the Common. They’re all showing the signature mark of State Street Barbers: 1.Close shaves that only a straight razor can provide. 2.Sleek lines, fresh from a coif trim. 3.The most obvious giveaway: their carefree attitude that one acquires post-luxurious scalp and shoulder massage (both accompany every haircut.) Want to join this Boston movement? Swing by the barbershop!

There’s no lack of convenient pizza, burgers or delivery in Braintree. But to offer the specialty creations of Downtown at South Shore prices--now that’s not an easy task. But Easy Pie manages to pull it off with items like The Smoke Show Burger (won’t find this one on Barstool): an all-beef patty, bacon, grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms and swiss all topped with BBQ sauce. Surprise your tastebuds with The Beach Chair pizza: mango salsa, pineapple, prosciutto and mozzarella. Mmm, now that was easy!

The truth about Verdad (which means “truth” in Spanish)  is that they have the best margaritas and tapas on the Main Line. Think I’m a fibber? Guess again, Verdad is stocked with 30 different brands of tequila which you can get straight-up in newbie-friendly flights, salted in a margarita or segued into a speciality cocktail. Post-drinks, dive into the rich, kickin’ strawberry habenero guacamole and navigate the honey-sweet Pork Carnitas. Only then can you honestly say you’ve been on the Tour de Tapas.

Whewww, dog, you stink! At Bark Place’s DIY wash center, (stocked with shampoo, fluffy towels, and even toothbrushes), you can take your pup from dingy to doggy diva! Is Fido looking for the star treatment? Try the pro-grooming services or PlayCare so your pooch can make new friends. Surely, Fido wants some fly gear, too—the boutique has sweet stuff like biodegradable doodoo bags (environmentally and shoe friendly!) and fashion collars. Who let the dogs out? Especially looking THAT good.

Members of the United Nations, I propose that you hold your next meeting at Whirled Peace Frozen Yogurt in the city of brotherly love. Seated atop  futuristic bar stools, world leaders can come together over cups of tangy Island Surfer, (a righteous blend of coconut, orange and mango), savory Egg Nog and “Is there a girl scout on staff?” Chocolate Mint Fro Yo. They’d put down their verbal arms and pick up their spoons for a friendly spoon-bump. Isn’t Whirled Peace sweet?

Tadpole babies = edgy babies. Your kid will work it at breakfast in one of Tadpole's modern high chairs. New moms, you don't have to give up fashion for function! Sling that trendy Petunia Pickle Bottom diaper bag over your shoulder with pride! If you don’t have kids your own, we’ll let you in on a secret: Tadpole is a holiday gold mine! It’s stocked with parent must-haves and tons of toys for babies and toddlers alike. Tiny tads grow up fast, but they’ll always have memories of their favorite Tadpole toys.

We know you’re not a Dumbo (though we’re not sure about how you were acting last night), so listen when Grover Taylor, owner of Eat at Jumbo’s says his Steazy Cheesy Garlic Breadsticks will cure any hangover. Woah. Jumbo’s just re-calibrated MY steaz--changing up my cuisine with style and ease. Appease and please your fans of veggies with soy cheeses and Vegginini Paninis.The biggest appetites call for the MAMMOTH burger--1 lb. of beefy goodness, rendering your hunger and hangover extinct.

An Irish Bar in the North End? How did this place sneak it’s way onto the gnocchi pub crawl route? By doing everything right! With a reasonably priced menu ($10 plates) of fresh seafood, crispy pub appetizers and heart-searing sandwiches, Goody’s packs the patio...and the dining room...and the sky lounge every night. Who needs Grandma’s secret sauce, when you’ve got four huge hunks of dark, Guiness soaked bread and a brew on the way?
